exposed TO its influence, with mere rapidity thq it

heating the bark to such degree. Us to arrest or
nulify the progress OF the sap.''

IMrtf,rI Concenioa. have noticed in the

lartv of New England in 1919.


He was not claGed by them as partizan, nor
did he seek favour at their hand. Ii our memory
serves us we'll the measure OF the Hartford Con
yrnton was proposed in Fanueil Hall, by MIR. Pick
eripp, a, present the most jealous opponent OF Mr.
Adams. Some of the warmest friends Of that mea-
sure, are row among the active partlzans of Gen.
Jackson--and now many papers that hold an esti-

facts must be obFiou, to every person capable o OBJ

der themselves liable, at least to ridicnle.


Our observations meant to correct an error,
not to promote party views. 1t is doing injustice to
the public, TO place daily before the community. as
truth, what few minutes enquiry would show to be

bly deficient i'll Il knu~ledge of their country ) his
